newsitem.title: INDIA: Gulf Air, Kuwait Airways must sell stakes in Jet.
newsitem.headline: Gulf Air, Kuwait Airways must sell stakes in Jet.

text.p: India's Civil Aviation Ministry has given Gulf Air and Kuwait Airways until October 15 to sell their 20-percent stakes in private Indian carrier Jet Airways, a Jet spokesman said on Saturday.
"We have been given time by Civil Aviation Ministry till October 15 to disinvest," a Jet Airways spokesman told Reuters.

The cabinet in April barred foreign airlines from holding equity stakes in the domestic aviation sector. The policy effectively scuttled a proposed $600-million tie-up between Singapore Airlines Ltd and India's Tata group.
The cabinet also upheld a rule limiting foreign firms which are not airlines to 40 percent equity stakes in domestic airlines. Non-resident Indians can hold stakes of up to 100 percent.
"The process has already started. The board has already decided to disinvest 40 percent foreign equity," the spokesman said. Gulf Air and Kuwait Airways each own a 20-percent stake in Jet.
Asked who will buy the stakes owned by the two foreign airlines, the spokesman said: "That process is not known at the moment." There was no estimate of the value of the stakes.
